title: An apology to the those involved with the Yorick VGU
body:
I wanted to apologize for my rashness with this VGU. I used foolish words and speculations when I saw teasers in lieu of staying my tongue and waiting for the whole product to be revealed. I need to learn patience in this area, and if any disagreements are to be had, I shall try my best to articulate my concerns- as my finer gentry have flawlessly done. 

I needed time to rectify my vision with your vision of Yorick. And I see the wisdom in what you did. There are some unique elements I feel were lost, but on the whole this is a much better product.

I feel his voice over is fantastic. The login theme is dark, brooding, atmospheric, and daunting. I also feel the Undertaker skin was given a lot of personality and care which keeps alive the pure grave digger aspects. 

I am certainly considering putting the time into this new Yorick, and if I can make it work, I will replace him as my main {{champion:6}} . 

I once again apologize.

One of my big problems is that his lore is basically {{champion:110}} . He took on dark power to overcome dark power. Also he's another arbiter of life and death {{champion:30}} {{champion:203}}  and {{champion:202}}  sees himself as an arbiter. It fells a bit uninspired.
To be fair,Varus is out for revenge,while Yorick tries to stop a country full of undeads.

Varus is for revenge, not particularly an arbiter of life(he isn't even going to save his!) or death. Karthus just wants to spread the blessing of being an undead corpse, not exactly a "someone who holds the supreme right" to decide whether someone lives or dies. If Karthus got his way, EVERYONE would be "dead". Kindred **is** death, and is on a whole different level than everyone else(and literally an arbiter, they come for you, you dead). And Jhin _sees_ himself as an arbiter, but he also sees himself as an artist. Soo...

Meanwhile, Yorick is doing what he can to save a corrupted land. His story may be parallel to Varus's, but it is not overlapping.
Karthus isn't an arbiter of life and death, he preferred death over life so he became a lich, so he could be dead. He doesn't care about the others being dead or alive.
I feel like, unlike Varus, there is more to Yorick's lore besides just him being the standard "Good using evil" archetype.

to be fair, {{champion:203}} and {{champion:202}} came waaaay after {{champion:83}}.

I think his voice over is really slow and induces drowsiness in me. I think this is the weakest point of his VGU, my eyes literally start dropping when his low, soothing voice over starts. 

I also think he is boring. He has a very monotonous playstyle of spam q, and his w/e feel very lackluster. While his Q is really fucking strong, thats his only offensive spell really. 

He has a slow paced farm heavy, q spam playstyle like Nasus. However Nasus has moments of exciting gameplay, ie when he ghosts after enemies or ults and 1 v 5s the enemy. Yorick doesnt have any redeeming/ fun moments in his gameplay.

I'm sure some players will enjoy his zen/ monotonous playstyle, but he isnt much fun for me

Just my two cents !
